intro: Eriogonum ochrocephalum var. gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and often covered in fine hairs, and the flowers are usually pale green or yellowish in color. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in sagebrush communities.
